subject: world's greatest mashup
body:
coworkers i'd never met in person were in town and we got to have a lovely al fresco dinner at magic hour at the beginning of a three day weekend

smoking a joint on a street corner while waiting for a cab

e's karaoke birthday was the most fun time, too many great moments to list them all but together we sang "stereo" by pavement, "the good life" by weezer (which i dedicated to her birthday), "all the young dudes", world's greatest mashup "easy heaven" by the cure/the commodores, and, to close the night, "after hours" by the velvet underground

d singing "lost cause" + her glitter makeup look

the delight of angelfood cake with buttercream frosting when you are expecting something more fondant-heavy and less viscerally satisfying because of the sculptural quality of the cake (which is made to resemble a burger and fries)

the [crunchiest fried chicken](https://www.instagram.com/tokipdx/?hl=en) i've ever had

digiorno's croissant crust frozen pizza, which we have bought a number of times now and is the most satisfying frozen pizza i have eaten to date.

the fake restaurant menus that chelsea peretti has been writing ([1](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRPoEztsw0i/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link), [2](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRQFKsOMOTA/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link), [3](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRQHnkhs7uQ/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link), [4](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRRz1OLsCsw/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link)) (fred's is the most obvious but is also my favorite)

[this great review](https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/08/books/review/rivka-galchen-everyone-knows-your-mother-is-a-witch.html) by sarah, i want to read this book now

that i successfully cancelled a bunch of streaming subscriptions i wasn't really using earlier in the month, but that our paramount+ month was still active and so we watched _a quiet place, part 2_ last night, which was in no way revelatory but was an entertaining romp (and much preferable to have cillian murphy as the male lead instead of john krasinski)

the [new clairo album](https://open.spotify.com/album/32ium7Cxb1Xwp2MLzH2459), which is perfect summer afternoon music

coworkers i'd never met in person were in town and we got to have a lovely al fresco dinner at magic hour at the beginning of a three day weekend

smoking a joint on a street corner while waiting for a cab

e's karaoke birthday was the most fun time, too many great moments to list them all but together we sang "stereo" by pavement, "the good life" by weezer (which i dedicated to her birthday), "all the young dudes", world's greatest mashup "easy heaven" by the cure/the commodores, and, to close the night, "after hours" by the velvet underground

d singing "lost cause" + her glitter makeup look

the delight of angelfood cake with buttercream frosting when you are expecting something more fondant-heavy and less viscerally satisfying because of the sculptural quality of the cake (which is made to resemble a burger and fries)

the [crunchiest fried chicken](https://www.instagram.com/tokipdx/?hl=en) i've ever had

digiorno's croissant crust frozen pizza, which we have bought a number of times now and is the most satisfying frozen pizza i have eaten to date.

the fake restaurant menus that chelsea peretti has been writing ([1](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRPoEztsw0i/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link), [2](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRQFKsOMOTA/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link), [3](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRQHnkhs7uQ/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link), [4](https://www.instagram.com/p/CRRz1OLsCsw/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link)) (fred's is the most obvious but is also my favorite)

[this great review](https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/08/books/review/rivka-galchen-everyone-knows-your-mother-is-a-witch.html) by sarah, i want to read this book now

that i successfully cancelled a bunch of streaming subscriptions i wasn't really using earlier in the month, but that our paramount+ month was still active and so we watched _a quiet place, part 2_ last night, which was in no way revelatory but was an entertaining romp (and much preferable to have cillian murphy as the male lead instead of john krasinski)

the [new clairo album](https://open.spotify.com/album/32ium7Cxb1Xwp2MLzH2459), which is perfect summer afternoon music
